Reviews.Title: Motion Detection Reflects on Glass
Reviews.Author: R. M. Mayhew
Reviews.Content: My Lorex cameras have what they call a "passive infrared" motion detection system.  I know nothing about the technical aspects of this system, but when I install a Lorex camera in this housing, it is fine in regular light.  When it is dark, the motion sensing part of the camera reflects on the glass in this unit and causes it to display a starburst effect.  When motion is detected is goes off and the picture is ok.  At rest though, you can no longer see a picture in the dark.Installation was trickier than others have indicated.  I did not have a screw in bolt that would fit into the space allowed to mount the camera.  Maybe that part was not included in my package, but I solved the problem by purchasing a special sized bolt at a local hardware store.

Reviews.Title: Great product, exactly what it says it is
Reviews.Author: Craig S. Burnett "On-Camera Talent and Video ...
Reviews.Content: Great product, well-built, worked great for me.  Not too much more to tell...it's a metal box.Okay, so Amazon insists I write more.  It's everything I hoped an enclosure would be, and so much more.It was better than CATS.I would see it again and again.

Reviews.Title: Great price and quality. Minor annoyances to be aware of
Reviews.Author: Behzad "Behzad"
Reviews.Content: This product at this price is an amazing deal. The issues listed here are simply minor things that people should be aware of when buying.1. The housing latch on the back is only semi functional. It does latch and provide some use in securing the lid down, but with minimal effort, I was able to pop the latch off the metal part of the housing rendering the latch useless. This is not a big deal as my cameras were mounted 20' up but something people should take into account when wanting to secure the housings with a lock (the lock portion does not affect the latch being able to pop off)2. The cable wire holes in the base of the unit are not standard size. They are about a little less than 1/2" which made it difficult to adapt with my MC conduit cable/tubing adapters. Again not a big deal as I was able to put my pliers in the opening and round out a bigger whole that took my adapter, but just something to be aware of. Note: If you are not using MC aluminium or Liquid Tight tubing then the included adapter hole covers work well with RG59 cable.3. The interior mounting hardware is excellent. Very easy to pop in and out to get your camera mounted in just the right spot. The included smaller screws secure your location once you have that perfect shot. The quality of the metal and glass is excellent for this price point. I also like the versatility I have in mounting the housing as I was able to bring the mount all the way to the back of the housing and point it at a steep angle while still maintaining its full rigidity. Also doesn't seem to fog up and I am not using a blower.TL:DR Great unit for a great price. Just be aware of the non standard (1/2") cable holes and non secure latch mechanism.

Reviews.Title: Good, Solid product for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Roger F.
Reviews.Content: I have a covert surveillance system at my home, but wanted something more than obvious for the purpose of deterring thieves.  This is a very well built unit that gives a lot of flexibility for mounting video cameras inside.  Well gasket-ted for weather and dust protection, and a solid, 3-axis mounting system.

Reviews.Title: Adequate protection, but not as stable as I'd have liked.
Reviews.Author: B. Pearce
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these as part of a weather cam project.  After putting a 16mm lens (for better zoom) on a Ubiquiti Aircam H.264 Megapixel Indoor/Outdoor IP Camera, I found that the lens cover included on that camera was not high enough quality, and it added a blur effect which became very significant after installing a higher zoom lens.  Removing the lens cover fixed the image, but created a point of water ingress, so I needed an enclosure to keep the camera safe from the elements.  This does that quite well.  The optical quality of the front window is much better than the lens cover that came with the camera, and distortion is minimal.However the mount is not very solid.  The mount flexes and the enclosure shakes in the wind almost as if it was made of plastic.  Fortunately, the camera has a fast enough shutter speed that there is no significant motion blurring even with a 16mm lens.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: father of 4
Reviews.Content: Prodcut came delivered quickly and in good shape.  Cover fit easliy and was easy to mount.  been using for a while now and no problems.  ordered two others after the first test.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor Weatherproof Heavy Duty Aluminum CCTV Security Camera encloseur
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Good solid unit.  Quality fit, durable and easy to use.  I have used this unit to protect my security cameras and has seen many storms and extreme temperatures.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Standard case
Reviews.Author: Jerome B. Smith
Reviews.Content: is a standard case it worked well but is no better or worse than any of the other cases I have used. Here at the coast no case ( metal or plastic) lasts long so ....

Reviews.Title: Little more than i bargained for
Reviews.Author: YipYipFox
Reviews.Content: BIG housing. Looks just like pelco inclosures. Its a little more than a bargained for. Its a nice cast aluminum housing with an aluminum base so its going to be easier to put up. It also is heated which was nice. Just have to find another use for it. Other than that is is a pretty cool housing. Might add a PTZ base to it

Reviews.Title: a great houseing at a great price.
Reviews.Author: ARD GROUP INC
Reviews.Content: Item is great very durable I used it to house a dummy camera but it would be great for a real camera. Its about the same size as the ones you see outside wally world. All nessary monting and hardware is included. It don't come with a heater or blower but has the nessary mounting inside to put one if you want. Can be locked but most mount these high enough it don't really matter as long as it keeps the lids closed which it does.

Reviews.Title: Not compatible with cameras with center bolt
Reviews.Author: signal shark
Reviews.Content: The enclosure has a central rail that protrudes up in contact with the plastic slider where the camera has to be mounted, therefore there is no space for the bolt that connects the camera to the slider. It would probably work well with cameras that have a different mounting location than a center hole but definitely this enclosure seems incompatible with axis cameras. I will have to return and order another one.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Grigori Efimovich Rasputin "The Mad Monk"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased several others of similar size and shape for other sources in the past and in comparing this one to them there are a couple of points I'd like to make.First the quality of this item is much higher and the price is much lower - making this plurchase an excellent value.  It has an all an all aluminum housing with a glass screen.  All the hardware including hinges and screws is of excellent quality as well - no cheap plastic. In other words this is the Great Deal.It is obvious that this unit is intended for extended outdoor use in most weather conditions.  It doesn't have a fan or heater inside,but I'm sure those can easily be obtained if its an important factor.  It comes with wood screws for mounting so if you plan to install it against  any other material then I strongly advise purchasing the appropriate fastening items.In my case I will be using it as a deterrent only without a camera inside so will be placing window tint material on the inside of the glass screen.  Just 4x4 inch scrap from the local window tinters will do the trick.  Experienced bad guys are always looking for cameras when they are casing neighborhoods and I believe this unit will be an excellent addition to my existing "collection". In fact I may replace my other units since this one is so much better.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Cutty Sark Sailor
Reviews.Content: Heavier than I thought. Mounting is great. Cam mount internal good.Noted a comment in ratings about wind vibration: The three I have installed under a house eave have great wind stability, considering, note little or no vibration. It is possible to have the mounting bolts tight, but not tight enough. Mine have only shown slight vibration in winds greater than 48mph. Not noticeable unless you're looking for it.

Reviews.Title: Its huge and can be seen from miles away not cool
Reviews.Author: ernesto camero
Reviews.Content: i knew these case things were big but its huge when it comes down to it its just metal shaped in a box that being said I will not use it and probably not return so its sitting dead weight, Im ok with that just wanting to let others know that this is more a business not residential camera box its big and obnoxious and sticks out like a sore thumb, and you can tell this is an older model box which burglars might just disregard all together. get a smaller box for about the same price you will be much more satisfied with something smaller than this ginormous humualoid product of a security box

Reviews.Title: Strong well built
Reviews.Author: S. Rambocas
Reviews.Content: This is a well built system. U would love it if the wires were able to run trough the mounting arm but this is not the case. Too enclose the wires i attempted to use standard 1/2 inch PVC conduate to protect the lines but the port for the lines are to small for this so i had to open the port with a drill to compensate. After that it work superbly and the lines are well secured in a tough tubing entering the walls.

Reviews.Title: cameras housing
Reviews.Author: rebollo's
Reviews.Content: we do have lorex cameras wireless and this product was perfect for our cameras we bought 5 strong we recommend this product

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: anoopster
Reviews.Content: Upgraded our existing 10yr old CCTV system with new cameras and dvr and realized that we should go ahead and change out the old housings. Mounted two of these 15ft above ground so vandalism is not an issue. Appears to be very solid and accommodated our box camera without any issues. The challenge is focusing the lens while balancing on a ladder. Of course we expect this to work fine while brand new (and in the summer) but you really have to wait several years and wet winters to really determine if this is a good product or not.  Our cameras focus on a lit parking lot at night so IR glare is not an issue for us since we done use it however I would recommend external IR lights (outside the housing) if you do need it.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: J. Burton
Reviews.Content: Very heavy duty construction -- I was surprised when I received it.  It has a latch and can be padlocked on the back.  This could also be used as a "dummy" camera if you wanted to, but the construction is so strong I don't know if I'd do that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Housing
Reviews.Author: Gary Tilton
Reviews.Content: This is a great outdoor camera housing. Protects the camera from the weather and vandals. Metal top and bottom section. Comes with hardware for mounting the camera and for mounting the housing, along with water tight connectors for wiring. Makes my inexpensive cameras look like industrial units.
